meanings.definition: To treat or worship someone or something as a god.
meanings.sent1: She deifies her favorite singer, considering him a musical deity.
meanings.sent2: The ancient civilization deifies the sun, believing it to be a powerful deity.
meanings.sent3: The little girl deifies her pet cat, thinking it has magical powers.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, he deifies all the qualities of a hero, making him larger than life.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece deifies the beauty of nature, capturing it in all its glory.

meanings.definition: To exalt or idealize someone or something to a godlike status.
meanings.sent1: He deifies his mentor, seeing him as a wise and infallible figure.
meanings.sent2: The author deifies love in his novels, portraying it as a force of nature.
meanings.sent3: The chef deifies his secret recipe, claiming it can make anyone a culinary genius.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's dedication deifies him in the eyes of his fans, turning him into a legend.
meanings.sent5: The poet's words deify the beauty of the sunset, elevating it to a celestial spectacle.
